content: Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de verschillende sleutelfuncties (key functions) onder de Solvency II-wetgeving genoemd in de overwegingen (recitals) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC. De specifieke functies worden opgesomd in overweging (30) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC: * De risicobeheerfunctie (risk-management function) * De compliancefunctie (compliance function) * De interne auditfunctie (internal audit function) * De actuariële functie (actuarial function) () Overweging (33) van dezelfde richtlijn bevestigt dat deze functies als sleutelfuncties worden beschouwd (). Daarnaast verwijzen de bronnen naar Artikel 42 van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC in de context van de "fit and proper" eisen die gelden voor de personen die deze sleutelfuncties bekleden ().
content_unformatted:
Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de verschillende sleutelfuncties (key functions) onder de Solvency II-wetgeving genoemd in de overwegingen (recitals) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC.

De specifieke functies worden opgesomd in overweging (30) van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC:
*   De risicobeheerfunctie (risk-management function)
*   De compliancefunctie (compliance function)
*   De interne auditfunctie (internal audit function)
*   De actuariële functie (actuarial function) (Source 4)

Overweging (33) van dezelfde richtlijn bevestigt dat deze functies als sleutelfuncties worden beschouwd (Source 5).

Daarnaast verwijzen de bronnen naar Artikel 42 van Richtlijn 2009/138/EC in de context van de "fit and proper" eisen die gelden voor de personen die deze sleutelfuncties bekleden (Source 2, Source 3).

content: Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de kerntaken van de sleutelfunctiehouders op een algemeen niveau beschreven. De bronnen specificeren niet de gedetailleerde taken voor elke afzonderlijke functie (risicobeheer, compliance, interne audit en actuariële functie), maar geven wel een overkoepelend beeld van hun rol. De kerntaken van de sleutelfuncties zijn: * Het uitvoeren van hun specifieke taken, waarvoor zij de benodigde autoriteit, middelen en operationele onafhankelijkheid moeten hebben. * Het rapporteren aan en adviseren van het bestuurs-, leidinggevend of toezichthoudend orgaan van de verzekerings- of herverzekeringsonderneming (). De overige bronnen benadrukken voornamelijk de vereisten waaraan de sleutelfunctiehouders moeten voldoen, zoals de "fit and proper" eisen, en de rapportageverplichtingen over deze functies, in plaats van een gedetailleerde lijst van hun taken ().

Op basis van de verstrekte bronnen worden de kerntaken van de sleutelfunctiehouders op een algemeen niveau beschreven. De bronnen specificeren niet de gedetailleerde taken voor elke afzonderlijke functie (risicobeheer, compliance, interne audit en actuariële functie), maar geven wel een overkoepelend beeld van hun rol.

De kerntaken van de sleutelfuncties zijn:
*   Het uitvoeren van hun specifieke taken, waarvoor zij de benodigde autoriteit, middelen en operationele onafhankelijkheid moeten hebben.
*   Het rapporteren aan en adviseren van het bestuurs-, leidinggevend of toezichthoudend orgaan van de verzekerings- of herverzekeringsonderneming (Source 4).

De overige bronnen benadrukken voornamelijk de vereisten waaraan de sleutelfunctiehouders moeten voldoen, zoals de "fit and proper" eisen, en de rapportageverplichtingen over deze functies, in plaats van een gedetailleerde lijst van hun taken (Source 2, Source 3, Source 5).

Reporting & Disclosure Guidelines

Guideline 3 - Governance Structure

1.15. Under section “B.1. General information on the system of governance” of the

SFCR as defined in Annex XX of the Delegated Regulation, insurance and reinsurance undertakings should explain how the key functions have the necessary authority, resources and operational independence to carry out their tasks and how they report to and advise the administrative, management or supervisory body of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking (hereinafter “AMSB”).

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER IX > Section 3 > Article 273

  1. Insurance and reinsurance undertakings shall establish, implement and maintain documented policies and adequate procedures to ensure that all persons who effectively run the undertaking or have other key functions are at all times fit and proper within the meaning of Article 42 of Directive 2009/138/EC.

  2. The assessment of whether a person is fit shall include an assessment of the person's professional and formal qualifications, knowledge and relevant experience within the insurance sector, other financial sectors or other businesses and shall take into account the respective duties allocated to that person and, where relevant, the insurance, financial, accounting, actuarial and management skills of the person.

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER XII > Section 1 > Article 294

  1. The solvency and financial condition report shall include all of the following information regarding the ‘fit and proper’ policy of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking:

(a) a description of the undertaking's specific requirements concerning skills, knowledge and expertise applicable to the persons who effectively run the undertaking or have other key functions;

(b) a description of the undertaking's process for assessing the fitness and the propriety of the persons who effectively run the undertaking or have other key functions.

  1. The solvency and financial condition report shall include all of the following information regarding the risk management system of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking:

Solvency II – Level 2 Regulation

TITLE I > CHAPTER XIII > Section 1 > Article 308

  1. The regular supervisory report shall include all of the following information regarding the compliance of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking with fit and proper requirements:

(a) in accordance with the requirements set out in Article 42 of Directive 2009/138/EC, a list of the persons in the undertaking that are responsible for key functions;

(b) information on the policies and processes established by the undertaking to ensure that those persons are fit and

proper.

  1. The regular supervisory report shall include all of the following information regarding the risk management system of the insurance or reinsurance undertaking:

(a) information on the undertaking's risk management strategies, objectives, processes and reporting procedures for each category of risk;

(b) information on significant risks that the undertaking is exposed to over the life-time of its insurance and reinsurance obligations, and how these have been captured in its overall solvency needs;

**Analyzing Key Tasks**

I've zeroed in on the core question: identifying the essential tasks of key function holders within the Solvency II framework. My process now involves a targeted scan of the provided materials. I am looking for specific keywords like "key function," "tasks," "duties," and "responsibilities" to pinpoint relevant passages. This initial sifting should bring clarity to these core responsibilities.


**Uncovering Task Details**

I'm now diving deeper into the nuances of key function responsibilities. My analysis reveals that while the regulations emphasize the *need* for key functions and the "fit and proper" criteria of their holders, they are surprisingly light on explicitly listing specific *tasks*. I'm focusing my search now on phrases implying activities and processes, specifically within the SFCR requirements. The sources suggest these tasks are described within broader governance structures.


**Unearthing Task Descriptions**

The hunt continues! I've been pouring over the remaining sources, but they're proving surprisingly indirect. While they consistently emphasize the *importance* of key functions and the "fit and proper" criteria, concrete task lists are elusive. I've had to dig for clues within broader discussions of governance, reporting requirements, and the risk management system. It appears the tasks are interwoven with the overarching frameworks, and I am zeroing in on how they "carry out their tasks" and report to the board. I suspect the real key might be in the reporting requirements regarding these functions.


**Uncovering Key Function Duties**

I've been analyzing the provided sources and have found a crucial point: the specific, itemized tasks of the key function holders are not explicitly detailed in these documents. Instead, the focus is on the requirements for these roles, such as the "fit and proper" criteria and reporting obligations. It appears the core functions across all key function holders are "carrying out their tasks" and "reporting to and advising the administrative body" (AMSB). I'll need to explore the specific activities and actions that constitute "their tasks" based on the context and implied nature of each key function, considering the framework and regulations.


**Synthesizing General Tasks**

I've discovered that the provided sources don't offer a specific list of tasks for each key function, but instead emphasize the "fit and proper" criteria and reporting aspects. However, I have identified a core duty applicable to all key functions:  "carrying out their tasks" and "reporting to and advising the administrative, management or supervisory body". These general principles underscore the functions' essential role within the Solvency II framework.
